metadata.title: CVE-2022-0168 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A denial of service (DOS) issue was found in the Linux kernelâ€™ssmb2_ioctl_query_info function in the fs/cifs/smb2ops.c Common InternetFile System (CIFS) due to an incorrect return from the memdup_userfunction. This flaw allows a local, privileged (CAP_SYS_ADMIN) attacker tocrash the system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-0168` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-35-generic - 5.15.0-35.36
linux-image-5.15.0-35-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-35.36
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-35-generic - 5.15.0-35.36
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-35-generic-64k - 5.15.0-35.36
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1008-kvm - 5.15.0-1008.8
No subscription required
